meaningMnemonic: You <radical>loiter</radical> around with a <radical>weapon</radical> because you're currently doing your <kanji>service</kanji> and <kanji>duty</kanji> to your country. You're standing guard outside, waiting just in case something will happen.
readingMnemonic: You're about halfway through your <kanji>service</kanji>, when a <reading>yak</reading> (やく) walks by. It stops directly in front of you and grunts. "Excuse me, Mr. Yak, but it's my <kanji>duty</kanji> to escort you away from my country."
